title: 115_hr4282
content: The Act titled "Protecting UACs Through Enhanced Sponsor Vetting Act of 2017" introduces additional procedures for placement decisions for unaccompanied alien children. Section 462 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include providing notification to the Governor and county executive regarding the placement of unaccompanied alien children with sponsors. Coordination with juvenile justice professionals is also required. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to involve various officials in ensuring the safety and appearance of unaccompanied alien children in legal proceedings, protecting them from potential harm or exploitation. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to ensure the safety of unaccompanied alien children by conducting criminal background checks on sponsors and placing them in safe environments. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include additional procedures for making placement determinations for unaccompanied alien children, such as conducting criminal records checks on prospective sponsors and consulting with relevant law enforcement entities. The Director must consult with law enforcement entities before placing an unaccompanied alien child with a sponsor, considering any criminal activity. State and local governments will be notified of the placement decision, including relevant officials. Intelligence on transnational criminal organizations is also considered. The Director provides information on membership in transnational criminal organizations during the placement process of unaccompanied alien children.
